math_block.exponentiation_logic.structure: Exponentiation is determined by masked numeral glyphs that follow (or are displaced in reference to) a base glyph.
math_block.exponentiation_logic.direction: When placed side by side, glyphs are read left to right (e.g., ğŸ€â±­â±¸ = 3^21).
math_block.exponentiation_logic.displacement: Exponents may be cast non-sequentially using glyph displacement tags. Logical interpretation is based on spell shape, not glyph proximity.
math_block.exponentiation_logic.note: If a glyph is explicitly displaced (e.g., with â†„ or Æ¼), its position is resolved according to that logic before exponentiation is interpreted.

math_block.math_operators.grouping.description: Used to denote enclosed mathematical expressions or ritual groups. Behaves like parentheses in mathematical order of operations, but implies containerization of symbolic logic.
math_block.math_operators.exponent.glyph: â±¶
math_block.math_operators.exponent.description: Symbolically marks an exponentiation relationship between glyphs. Optional if masked numerals follow a base glyph naturally.

math_block.math_operators.multiply.description: Indicates binding, growth, or duplication. Symbolic of expansion or entanglement within glyphs or values.
math_block.math_operators.divide.glyph: â±¤
math_block.math_operators.divide.description: Implies partition, separation, or splitting of symbolic energy between operands. Often used with displacement.
math_block.math_operators.add.glyph: ğŸœ
math_block.math_operators.add.description: Represents layering, summoning, or constructive combination of glyphs or values.
math_block.math_operators.subtract.glyph: â±¡
math_block.math_operators.subtract.description: Draws from a value or cancels part of a structure. Does not imply deletion but rather redirection or pull.
